snippet: Michael A. Brown was charged with a single count of bribery for taking $55,000 from F.B.I. agents purporting to seek his help in gaining city certification as a local business.
abstract: Michael A Brown, former Washington DC city councilor, is charged with bribery after being accused of accepting cash from federal agents posing as business owners; arrest rekindles attention to long-simmering corruption inquiry of city's government.
lead_paragraph: Michael A. Brown was charged with a single count of bribery for taking $55,000 from F.B.I. agents purporting to seek his help in gaining city certification as a local business.

headline.seo: Former D.C. Councilor Charged After F.B.I. Sting
headline.main: Ex-Councilman in Capital Is Charged With Bribery
headline.print_headline: Ex-Councilman in Capital Is Charged With Bribery
